page.title: 01Folly Top
page.content: Land rising from Tees River at 200m to 460m on northside of Teesdale. Lower slopes mainly enclosed pasture and meadow land.Higher slopes with heather moorland, rough grazing and conifer plantations. Folly Top is watershed area between Tees and Gaunless drainage (Langley Beck) Watershed cut by several deep cut glacial overspill channels. Seven isolated hill farms on edge of Eggleston village and mainly involved in stock rearing. Other houses at Folly Top formerly built for forestry workers. Several B roads converge on Folly Bank making it a busy section of the main traffic route through Teesdale. Outfall of Tyne Tees Tunnel has not been used except for one brief occasion to flush oil pollution from River Tees.
